Posted By: A3Kitsune (2/15/2010 6:08:00 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
2/5. At least it has trample. Early artifact creatures were almost always over costed, with the exception of the swiftly banned Juggernaut, to prevent access to powerful creatures from colors that weren't mean to have them (especially Blue). Plus Artifacts had some of the best acceleration and support in the game--even having an entire block where each card in the set supports or hurts artifacts in one way or another (Antiquities). But why did I vote 2/5 on this card? Well, it is flavorful at least. And common. There's a lot of dumb older cards that are both weak (even for the time) and rare.  
  
The story behind this card? Apparently its a true artifact from the old war on Ulgrotha that was discovered by a family of goblins and used as a bribe in a trial overseen by [Eron the Relentless](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Eron the Relentless). Later it was stolen by [Chandler](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chandler) and [Joven](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Joven).  
  
I do enjoy how Homelands had a story for every one of its cards, or so it seems. Except... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
2/5. At least it has trample. Early artifact creatures were almost always over costed, with the exception of the swiftly banned Juggernaut, to prevent access to powerful creatures from colors that weren't mean to have them (especially Blue). Plus Artifacts had some of the best acceleration and support in the game--even having an entire block where each card in the set supports or hurts artifacts in one way or another (Antiquities). But why did I vote 2/5 on this card? Well, it is flavorful at least. And common. There's a lot of dumb older cards that are both weak (even for the time) and rare.

The story behind this card? Apparently its a true artifact from the old war on Ulgrotha that was discovered by a family of goblins and used as a bribe in a trial overseen by Eron the Relentless. Later it was stolen by Chandler and Joven.

I do enjoy how Homelands had a story for every one of its cards, or so it seems. Except... (see all)

posts.post_content:
Playable in pauper with cards like [Etherium Sculpter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Etherium Sculpter) and [Glassdust Hulk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Glassdust Hulk). The first makes this guy cheaper and the second becomes both stronger and unblockable when this is played.
  
   
But as has already been said, not a good card.
